reviews.text: My wife and I stopped here on our way across Georgia for a wedding. Not expecting much - just needed a place to sleep for the night before continuing in the morning. Room was about what you would expect for the price.
reviews.title: Good night stop, but walls are super thin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real issue I had was that the walls in this place are the absolute thinnest of any hotel I think I've ever stayed in. Normally, this might not be a bad problem, but there are several truck stops located right around the hotel and, just before dawn, it sounded like every single truck in the state of Georgia was driving by the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel, a good experience, and several cuts above another Super 8 where we stayed. The room was big and roomy, the bed comfortable, the pillows nice and fluffy, which is not always the case. Also, the blackout curtains were heavy enough to really block out light. There was internet service, a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. The TV got dozens of channels. The complimentary breakfast consisted of bread, bagels, coffee and two cold cereals, but no fruit or pastries. Nevertheless, I would stay here again as the location was perfect for our needs.
reviews.title: Outstanding motel for either a night or a longer stay

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Super 8 Motel in Covington, GA for a five-night stay while visiting family in the area. The motel was outstanding in nearly every respect and would be an excellent place for either a night's stopover or an extended stay like ours.
reviews.title: A Surprising Pleasure
